jparsec.math

Class Interpolation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Interpolation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Interpolation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Tools for linear and spline interpolation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor for a 2d interpolation.
      Interpolation(double[] x, double[] y, double[] z, boolean allowExtrapolation)
      Deprecated. 
      Class GridChartElement should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interpolation

        public Interpolation(double[] x,
             double[] y,
             boolean allowExtrapolation)
              throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a 2d interpolation. Points are sorted in abscissa crescent order, and repeated points are eliminated.
        Parameters:
        x - X values.
        y - Y values.
        allowExtrapolation - True to allow extrapolation.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • Interpolation

        public Interpolation(double[] x,
             double[] y,
             double[] z,
             boolean allowExtrapolation)
              throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. Class GridChartElement should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
        Constructor for a 3d interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - X values.
        y - Y values.
        z - Z values.
        allowExtrapolation - True to allow extrapolation.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • linearInterpolation

        public double linearInterpolation(double x_point)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Linear interpolation method.
        Parameters:
        x_point - Interpolation point.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If allowExtrapolation is false and the point is outside the range.

      • isOutsideRange

        public boolean isOutsideRange(double x)
        Returns if a given value is outside the range of x values allowed for interpolation. In case extrapolation is allowed this range is unlimited.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value.
        Returns:
        True if the input value is outside the range of x values defined by the input array.

      • splineInterpolation

        public double splineInterpolation(double xx)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Spline interpolation method. This method requires that the points are sorted in abscissa crescent order. Method adapted from the math library by Michael Thomas Flanagan.
        Parameters:
        xx - Interpolation point.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value. In case the input value is close enough to the limit of the dataset (possible wrong output value) the spline interpolation with 3rd order is called, since this method requires less points before/after the input one. In case that method cannot be trusted, linear interpolation is returned.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the input point is outside the valid range and extrapolation is not allowed.

      • getCountValuesAbove

        public int getCountValuesAbove(double xx)
        Returns the number of x values in the dataset that are greater than the input value.
        Parameters:
        xx - Input x value.
        Returns:
        The number of x values above the input x. In case it is 2 or greater the spline interpolation with 3rd order of accuracy can be used. In case it is 8 or greater the other spline interpolation method can be used for points close to the upper limit of the dataset.

      • getCountValuesBelow

        public int getCountValuesBelow(double xx)
        Returns the number of x values in the dataset that are lower than the input value.
        Parameters:
        xx - Input x value.
        Returns:
        The number of x values below the input x. In case it is 2 or greater the spline interpolation with 3rd order of accuracy can be used. In case it is 8 or greater the other spline interpolation method can be used for points close to the lower limit of the dataset.

      • splineInterpolation3rdOrder

        public double splineInterpolation3rdOrder(double px,
                                 boolean fixWrongValue)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Spline interpolation method, up to third order of accuracy. This method requires that the points are sorted in abscisa crescent order.

        Reference:

        Basic Scientific Subroutines, F. R. Ruckdeschel. 1982.

        Parameters:
        px - Interpolation point. Must be between minimum and maximum value of x array, or equal to one of them.
        fixWrongValue - It is well known that for certain datasets spline interpolation can give wrong values for interpolation points close to the limit of the dataset. Set this flag to true to check for this and return the linear interpolation result in that case. Otherwise, an error will be launched.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the output value is probably wrong and fixWrongValue is set to false.

      • linearInterpolation

        public static double linearInterpolation(double[] x_val,
                         double[] y_val,
                         double x_point,
                         boolean allowExtrapolation)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Linear interpolation method.
        Parameters:
        x_val - X values.
        y_val - Y values.
        x_point - Interpolation point.
        allowExtrapolation - True to allow extrapolation.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If allowExtrapolation is false and the point is outside the range.

      • linearInterpolationInLogScale

        public double linearInterpolationInLogScale(double x_point)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Linear interpolation method, but applying natural logarithm to x and y values previous to calculations.

        Parameters:
        x_point - Interpolation point.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If allowExtrapolation is false and the point is outside the range.

      • linearInterpolation3d

        public double linearInterpolation3d(double x_point,
                           double z_point)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. The method GridChartElement.getSurfaceFromPoints(jparsec.math.DoubleVector[], int) should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
        Linear interpolation method in 3d. It is supposed that the x array contains several repeated points, each of them with a different value for the y coordinate, and also with some value for the z coordinates. Obviously, now the interpolation 'point' is the plain defined by an (x, z) point.
        Parameters:
        x_point - X interpolation point.
        z_point - Z interpolation point.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • linearInterpolation3dInLogScale

        public double linearInterpolation3dInLogScale(double x_point,
                                     double z_point)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. The method GridChartElement.getSurfaceFromPoints(jparsec.math.DoubleVector[], int) should be used instead, since it allows to use an irregurarly-sampled grid of points and its implementation has much more physical sense.
        Linear interpolation method in 3d in log scale. It is supposed that the x array contains several repeated points, each of them with a different value for the y coordinate, and also with some value for the z coordinates. Obviously, now the interpolation 'point' is the plain defined by an (x, z) point.
        Parameters:
        x_point - X interpolation point.
        z_point - Z interpolation point.
        Returns:
        The interpolated value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • MeeusInterpolation

        public double MeeusInterpolation(double x_point)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Performs interpolation as implemented by Meeus, Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 3. Number of points must be 2, 3, or 5, and sampling (separation between consecutive x points) must be constant.
        Parameters:
        x_point - The point to interpolate. Should be as close as possible to the intermediate point.
        Returns:
        The result.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of points is not 2, 3, neither 5.

      • MeeusExtremum

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D MeeusExtremum()
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Computes the (x, y) value of the extremum for a set of (x, y) pairs. The pairs should be selected so that the extreme is as close as possible to the intermediate point. See Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 3.
        Returns:
        The point of the extremum, or null if it is not found. The null case occurs when the number of points is 5 and the iteration process to get the extremum does not converge.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of points is not 3 neither 5.

      • MeeusZero

        public double MeeusZero()
                 throws JPARSECException
        Computes the zero of a set of (x, y) pairs by interpolation, following Meeus (Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 3).
        Returns:
        The x value so that y = 0.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of points is not 2, 3, neither 5, or if the number of points is 3 or 5 but iteration did not converge.

      • LagrangeInterpolation

        public double LagrangeInterpolation(double x)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Performs Lagrange interpolation as given by Meeus in Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 3.
        Parameters:
        x - The interpolation point, should be within the range from minimum to maximum input x values for a correct output.
        Returns:
        The value. No check is done, so use with care, since for certain datasets and close to the range limit of x values the output can be wrong.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the input point is outside range and extrapolation is not allowed.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string with the list of points.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(boolean useSpline,
                   int overSampling)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart showing the input data and the interpolated data.
        Parameters:
        useSpline - True to use spline for interpolation, false for linear.
        overSampling - The number of points in the interpolated data respect the original number of points. 1 for the same number, 2 for twice, ...
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
